A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It has its moments\, but overall\, it drags and relies heavily on repetitive\, trance-like\, interstellar walkie-talkie moments between force-sensitive characters to move the plot along. In an era of big-budget\, hour-long television episodes\, The Last Jedi contributes too little to the Star Wars mythos to warrant a full-fledged film\, and it just might leave fans wondering how much steam this franchise has left. It’s more of the same old rebels fighting the same old fight\, wondering how they’ll survive\, but vowing that the war is just beginning. Wasn’t Anakin supposed to bring balance to the force? Disney seems more than willing to forget this\, if it means filling the shelves with stuffed alien penguins just in time for the holidays.
